name: Clin M Pancreas Body Tail
title: Clinical M
notes:
**Note:**  The lesser sac of the peritoneum, or omental bursa, is the cavity in the abdomen formed by the lesser and greater omentum; the pancreas forms part of the posterior wall of the lesser sac.

**Distant lymph nodes**

    Pericholedochal (common bile duct)
        Pyloric
           Infrapyloric
           Retropyloric
           Subpyloric
           Suprapyloric
    Porta hepatic nodes
    Superior mesenteric (see N[regional lymph nodes] for mesenteric, NOS)
